intro: Masdevallia dorisiae, commonly known as the Dorisia orchid, is a rare and exquisite orchid species native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its intricate, often colorful floral structures. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small to medium in size, with a distinctive shape and vibrant hues that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Masdevallia dorisiae is considered a delicate and endangered species.
